snippet: The health economist apologized to a House panel for making “glib, thoughtless” comments about the American public when assessing the Affordable Care Act.
abstract: Health economist Dr Jonathan Gruber testifies before House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform and apologizes for negative remarks about American public's understanding of health care reform law; Gruber, paid consultant for Obama administration in assessing Affordable Care Act, says his comments were inaccurate and unacceptable and praises law in his testimony.
lead_paragraph: The health economist apologized to a House panel for making “glib, thoughtless” comments about the American public when assessing the Affordable Care Act.

headline.main: Jonathan Gruber of M.I.T. Regrets ‘Arrogance’ on Health Law
headline.print_headline: Economist Says He’s Sorry for ‘Arrogance’ on Health Law
